intro: Meoschium rugosum, commonly known as the rough meadow grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in moist meadows, stream banks, and other wetland habitats. The plant has a fibrous root system and produces tufted,丛生的 shoots with narrow, grass-like leaves that are often hairy or rough to the touch. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikes and are typically wind-pollinated. Meoschium rugosum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
